title: Template example: Cabinet/ministerial memo (structure demonstration)
author: (author)
reliability: Label provenance: original/copy/edition; note gaps; confidence level.
summary: This is a **template** Document Card showing how entries will be structured for auditability and citation.
takeaways: Record the document’s purpose (administrative, military, propaganda, etc.) in neutral terms.
Note what the document explicitly states vs what is inferred.
Crosslink to related documents and to the hub page.
scholarship_notes: Add 1–3 citations to reputable scholarship that uses or discusses this type of document.

title: Template example: Meeting minutes (structure demonstration)
author: (secretariat)
reliability: Explain the record-keeping context and whether the minutes are verbatim, summarised, or reconstructed.
summary: A second template card to demonstrate variety in document types and reliability notes.
takeaways: Minutes often omit dissent; treat them as partial views of deliberation.
Check for follow-up documents: directives, implementation reports, correspondence.
Use tags to connect to governance, command, or propaganda hubs as appropriate.
scholarship_notes: Add citations to works discussing decision-making structures and documentary records.
